thread.title: Was that a deer or the sound of a squeaky door closing? Animal makes bizarre screeching noise for tourists in Japan
thread.title_full: Was that a deer or the sound of a squeaky door closing? Animal makes bizarre screeching noise for tourists in Japan | Daily Mail Online

author: Jake Polden For Mailonline
title: Was that a deer or the sound of a squeaky door closing? Animal makes bizarre screeching noise for tourists in Japan
text:
15 shares 3
View
comments
This is the bizarre moment a deer made an unusual screeching sound - sending tourists into fits of laughter during their travels around Japan.
Gavin Shapiro, 26, from New York, recorded the footage with his girlfriend Kate in the city of Nara.
The screeching noise sounds disturbingly similar to the sound of a squeaky door closing.
Oh deer! Screaming deer sends tourists into fits of laughter The deer approaches people before making the bizarre sound, which resembled a squeaky door
Gavin told MailOnline: ‘‘You can just go walk up to them and feed them cookies. Sometimes they swarm you and you have 20 deer standing around you trying to get cookies.
 Next Drone captures footage of mysterious crop circles in Russian... Pet lover creates ingenious bumper device to go around blind... Brave brothers save 10ft hammerhead shark stranded on... 'They’re foreign tourists. You’re blatantly ripping them... 15 shares ‘I've never heard of a deer screaming like that and it took us all by surprise. Normally they make that squeaky door sound at the beginning of the video.’
In the clip, the deer approaches the filmmaker before making the bizarre sound.
Later the deer made a sinister screaming sound, which prompted the group to laugh hysterically
The video concluded with the deer quietening down slightly before finishing up with one last faint bleat
It begins screeching quite faintly before it grows louder.
The deer eventually makes a sinister screaming sound, which prompts the visitors to laugh hysterically.
The video concludes with the deer quietening down slightly before finishing with one last faint bleat.
